Aug 17 2009 	A gem in the heart of the Loop	My wife and I spent several days here celebrating our 40th wedding anniversary, and finishing the research om my book about Chicago. This hotel is a gem. First of all, the price was fabulous. I found a very low rate on a popular hotel-booking website, then called the Silversmith directly and they matched it -- just over a hundred dollars a night. NEVER pay rack rate! The staff was friendly and helpful. The room was spacious and immaculate. Elevators were quick, public areas were comfortable -- we enjoyed our 4-night stay enormously and will certainly return next time we are in the city. Two tips: 1) If you are very sensitive to noise, ask for a room away from the street. The L runs right outside the hotel and you will hear it. In interior rooms, however, the trains sound more like a whoosh of wind than a clattering train. 2) There is a large parking garage half a block south at Wabash and Monroe. If you park your car there yourself, you'll save about $7 a day extra the valet parking costs. We just parked our car and left it, and used the L and buses -- order visitor travel cards in advance from the CTA website for great savings.The hotel is on the east side of the Loop, very close to Macy's (nee: Marshall Fields), Grant Park, the Art Institute, theaters, restaurants, and all sorts of public transportation. If you're here to shop the Mag Mile, Michigan Avenue is one block east, a 2-minute walk, where a five minute bus ride on just about any bus that goes by will take you to that shopping Mecca. All rooms in the Silversmith have access to free high-speed internet via an Ethernet cable provided in the room. It worked flawlessly. The restaurant is open from early morning until 10 p.m., but we didn't eat there, having our own favorites. It's not cheap. An inexpensive breakfast option is half a block south at Wabash and Monroe (across from the parking garage I mentioned) called the Corner Bakery.

Aug 3 2009	Nice hotel with the exception of one rude front desk clerk.	My two sisters and I traveled to Chicago for a weekend getaway and stayed at the Silversmith for two nights. The hotel was a bit tricky to locate from the street due to only a small sign at the hotel entrance. We called the hotel and the front desk clerk was able to provide us with exact directions. We opted to park in the Self-Park garage located on Monroe Street (just around the corner from the hotel) instead of valet parking. The garage fee was $36 a night versus the $42 fee that the hotel charged. We checked in without any problems and went to our standard room with two double beds. Overall the room was clean and appeared to be spacious with very high ceilings. After a few minutes of getting settled in, we noticed a very foul fishy/urine smell on one of the beds. It was not only on the bed spread but also on the sheets. We promptly called the front desk to notify them and the front desk clerk, Rossi, was more than rude to us. He told us that it was unlikely that he had any other rooms with 2 double beds and he didn't know how soon a maid could come to take care of the bed. He then called back and in a rude tone of voice told us that he could give us a room with a king sized bed and a sleeper couch. We agreed to take this room. When we went back down to the front desk to get our new keys, we asked to speak to a manager. Rossi, snickered and shook his head at us before getting the manager. While the hotel manager listened to our complaint about the room and the rude treatment we had received, he did not offer an apology. After we left the hotel for a few hours, we returned to find a nice gift package with bottles of water, wine, snacks, and a card from management. The room we were moved to was a very nice suite. It had a refrigerator, microwave, and a tub with jets. We had no other problems with the hotel. The shower had great water pressure and plenty of hot water. While you could hear the "L" train, it was not an annoying sound by any means and did not bother us at all at night. This hotel was certainly not the nicest we have stayed in but for the price, it was just fine. All in all, we did have a decent stay at this hotel with the exception of our encounter with Rossi. All of the other hotel staff were pleasant. I think if we were to return to Chicago we would probably stay in a different location that was closer to the Magnificent Mile or the Navy Pier.

Aug 3 2009 	Nice hotel...terrible staff!	We stayed here because we were going to a very nearby theatre to see Jersey Boys. The hotel was very nice and clean but the staff was the most rude and unfriendly we have ever run across! We passed a bellman three times in the course of our first day there, spoke to him and he just looked right through us. He is the first person any guest sees and he was extremely rude! Bad start! The young man at the desk when we checked in was a little better but not by much. The room was very nice and clean but you had to walk sideways through it because there was so little space between the end of the bed and a huge cabinet that housed the tv. Once you managed to get past the bed and cabinet there was a ridiculousy large office space. Tiny room with close quarters but an oversized office and desk?? Not a good thing for leisure travelers! We were awoken at 5:15 am by several 20 something women, obviously drunk out of their minds running and screaming off the elevator and down the 8th floor hallway. I called the front desk only to receive a response of "What do you want me to do about it?" Excuse me, is it not your job to make sure the patrons at your hotel are safe and comfortable? I could not believe his response!! We did talk to the front desk clerk about this when we checked out, but based on the simple response that "she had no idea who that would have been that answered and spoke to me that way, but she would look into it" I highly doubt it will even be repeated.It was a nice hotel and in a location very close to many things to see, but the terribly unfriendly staff made it a place we would not recommend or stay again!!Parking was $42 a day!! (The internet stats it is $30!) We chose to walk a couple blocks and pay $20!

Aug 3 2009 	Location and value rock everything else needs help	If you are unfamiliar with Chicago and driving to the hotel, you will need to be a detective to actually find the hotel on Wabash. It will take you several trips around downtown Chicago to find it. Cool building and ok lobby. Not very welcoming or warm feeling. Nice lady at check in. The rooms, while large are about the darkest and gloomiest I have ever seen. The couches are in dark greys and the lighting is very poor. Nice large bathroom and the bed was great and spacious.I would recommend this hotel if you want to be in a safe, downtown hotel and want to be a good location. Wonderful proximity to Millenium Park and shopping downtown. I also got a very good rate online, so if you are a bargain traveler, you can get good rates, here.When I go to Chicago again, I would not stay at this hotel.

Jul 29 2009 	A Positive Surprise	We booked The Silversmith based on the reviews of others, but more than anything based on price/location. We make at least annual trips to Chicago, and have tended to stay somewhere along North Michigan. This was only our second shot at staying inside the Loop...and it was terrific. The location is, indeed, exceptional for Grant Park, Art Institute, downtown shopping, theater, etc. And El stations are literally at your doorstep. The entry of the hotel is almost hidden, but the rooms ar grand (we stayed in two.) You will read complaints about El noise, but city noise is part of the downtown Chicago experience. Don't stay here if you prefer the quiet, suburban chain hotels. This is older but in nice shape, large rooms, convenient to everything, and a real Chicago "immersion." And the staff treated us remarkably well. It is our new favorite Chicago hotel. Note that parking is very pricey, but why are you driving into Chicago's Loop?

Jul 23 2009 	Very nice!	The hotel was a bit understated as far as the entrance goes since it really only has a doorway with little indication of what is there (I have stayed at the Palmer House a couple of times so compared to the big cheery entrances for the Palmer House, the Silversmith entrance is bizarre). Anyway, the staff was quite nice and the doormen (and they were men) were always friendly. The room (910 I believe) was great. A king bed and a longish padded window seat. A nice chair and good desk set. Our view was not that great but the room was quiet, clean and comfortable. I stayed here to attend a conference at National Louis University. Very close to the University so that was great. I also liked that it was so close to the institute of arts and Millennial Park (I think that is what it is called). Lots of nearby restaurants and shopping too. We especially like Gage for drinks in the evening.

Jul 17 2009 	Refused to honor Priceline quote and receipt	The Silversmith has a certain amount of deco charm, and the location is very convenient to Millenium Park and the L train, but those are the only things it has going for it. Our room faced a brick wall, but I think the only other option was to face the noisy L train, so perhaps we got the best option of the two. We also asked for a high floor when we reserved the room 6 months ago, and we were put on the lowest floor. Most frustratingly, the hotel did not honor our Priceline quote. After quite a bit of haggling, they were only willing to knock $50 off the price of our entire 7-night visit, though our Priceline quote was much less. There were also a lot of small things that let you know that you weren't staying in a 3-star hotel, like the fact that they only order a few copies of the newspaper, so you have to get up early and rush downstairs to try to make sure you get one.

Jul 14 2009 	Good location; friendly staff; average on the rest	Silversmith Hotel is an average hotel in a great location with a friendly staff.You are only a five minute walk from the Art Institute and Millennium Park and ten to fifteen minutes from Wacker Drive and the Chicago River.In terms of getting there, you are right next to multiple L routes and a couple of blocks from the blue L line that takes you to O'Hare. I drove my car to the hotel to drop off and pick up my luggage and the valet parkers and busmen were very friendly and allowed us to park our car short term in the valet parking area.Check in and checkout were handled smoothly and other questions were answered by friendly people at the main desk.The room was good-sized with the sleep quarters in a separate room from the bathroom and a pretty small living room. I liked the Arts and Crafts furniture.Bathroom had very good water pressure and was just fine, as were the bath towels.They followed their stated environmental policies and did not wash our linens or towels as requested.So what makes me give this an average rating?Even though we were on the side away from the L, we could still hear it from our bedroom (that doesn't bother me, but it did bother my wife). There were no shades to pull closed so the light came pouring in. The mattress was not very supportive, nor the pillows.The Internet was free and was available both wired and wireless. Unfortunately, the service was kind of poky and spotty. I tried going back and worth between wired and wireless, but had to give up a couple of times because it was taking too long.Business office was pretty sad. There were two pretty old computers that inexplicably used the wireless signal and not wired access. That limited its speed. In addition, only one computer could use the printer at any one time. As cheap as computers are at this point, I couldn't figure out why they didn't just buy some newer computers with better capabilities.The T.V.s in the bedroom and living room were 25" CRTs and the remote didn't really work for one of them. It also turned on at a bracingly high volume.There were no recycling options in the building for paper, plastic bottles, plastic bags, etc.The power went out on Friday morning (utility issue, not their fault) and an elevator got stuck. It was still stuck when we left on Monday.All in all, I would stay at the hotel again, but given it was in the same price range as much nicer conference hotels, I would think twice if I could get into a nicer place.

Jul 11 2009 	Low Bull High Quality Great Value	We arrived at midnight, and were handled efficiently and well by the night staff when we found them (a small idiosyncrasy of the hotel is that its lobby is not at street level). It was clear from the lobby decor that if our room lived up to the same stylistic standard we wouldn't be disappointed, and we weren't. Our room was first class. There was nothing in it that we would criticize, and it showed the results of the painstaking makeover which we knew had been done. Service, when we needed it, was also first class - easy, friendly and without frills; and the location is terrific. We didn't hear any trains on our side of the building.

Jul 5 2009 	Great hotel location and value as long as you stay on courtyard side	The Silversmith is in the Jewelry District (about two blocks from Grant Park), and is immediately in front of an elevated train stop on the loop. The stop connects to four lines, which makes it very convenient to anywhere in Chicago. It also makes all street front rooms very noisy, not just from the passing/stopping trains but the train announcements, too. I stayed on the courtyard side and could still hear the noise, and the wind surges, created by each train. But, enough of the negatives. The hotel was very attractive, with rich oak furniture and paneling. The prairie dcor was reminiscent of Frank Lloyd Wright. The L-shaped room was approximately 600 square feet, with twin queen beds, a large bathroom and a large foyer. Lots of quality, small touches in the room. The service was first rate. My rate was only $122 (not including breakfast) thanks to hotel.com.

May 28 2009 	Good value but a few downfalls.	The Silversmith is very promising -- good location, nice big rooms, right price. A few issues make it a bit less than ideal, however.The good: we had a gigantic room with a king bed and pull-out sofa, along with a huge bathroom with separate shower and jacuzzi tub. The price was right at $90/night from Priceline.The bad: The hotel is right next to the El, so it is a little noisy, even on the other side of the building. Of course, this is also rather convenient if you want to take the metro. The staff was fine, though at times they seemed patronizing (talked very slowly, described everything they were doing -- it was odd, though perhaps a Chicago thing?). Worst aspect of the hotel was the "business center" -- a pair of seriously underpowered PCs and a low-ink inkjet printer that probably came free in a bundle. Trying to print a boarding pass for the flight home was an exercise in patience at best.Overall a fine stay for the price, but nothing particularly great.

May 27 2009 	Good Value for the money.	I booked this Hotel through Priceline for 80 dollars plus tax. Price was good when I booked it. Then afterwords, I started receiving promotions for 4 star Hotels for 100 dollars.Pros: My conclusion is for the money 80, is good. Clean, good bed, good towels, good and large bathroom. I 've got a room in the back, no L noise. Service is excellent, check in and check out ( they gave us a late check-out ).Cons: Although location is good, the Hotel is "under the L rails" which appears sad, odd and scary.Lobby is old, very old, big and dated. However, if you do not mind about it, it's fine.If you go during a weekend, I would recommend a more northern ( Michigan North) location....

May 23 2009 	Good hotel for a good price	Overall, I was pretty happy with the room, the location and the price. No complaints or anything. I enjoyed my stay here and would return to the hotel. It's not super fancy but you need to ask yourself what you're looking for..The hotel is located near the base of the L train and my first impression was that the area seemed a bit dodgey (and that was during the day) but the Hilton (Palmer House) is only a block away. Having walked around though the area a few times it seems totally fine. Also, the L train is right above the hotel and it's pretty noisy (I could hear it inside at the reception desk)The room is pretty large but rather dark (I was facing inward to a closed off area in the hotel complex. But if my option was facing the street and listening to the train, I'd prefer the inward view (and you could hear the train from this room but very faintly). The bathroom is large, the internet is free but they have an older tube tv. The fitness room comprises of two treadmills, a step climber, an elyptical machine, a bench and a small universal type machine. This is located a few doors down from the E. Madison subway entrance. I took a shuttle bus to the hotel and given the ride (over an hour and a half) I would recommend taking the subway/train. The hotel is also near the "bean" and the Art Institute of Chicago. Everything seems pretty walkable (Wacker street is probably a 15 minute walk away). You're within walking distance of deep dish pizza (Pizzano, Giordano's) and a bit farther out but walkable blues music (Blue Chicago).

May 21 2009 	The Silversmith exudes excellence!	I thoroughly enjoyed my stay at The Silversmith. I am not from Chicago but knowing friends who are, they informed me that I was definitely going to be in a great location being one block away from Millennium Park and Michigan Ave. Once I arrived, the bellmen were very prompt and had my luggage handled before I knew it. One of the things I thought to be unique of the hotel is that the main lobby is elevated to the second floor. It was a very nice presentation once the elevator doors opened. The lobby was spacious with a nice atmosphere and the front desk was happy to greet me. I had a reservation for a suite, and it was absolutely gorgeous! There were very nice surprise personal touches in the suite including a variety platter. The suite was very large which was unexpected, and despite the L train I noticed right in front, it was very quiet and I slept very well. Their staff was helpful and friendly in addressing any additional needs I had. I highly recommend The Silversmith, as I will continue to come back and stay in the future.

May 20 2009 	Great Place Doorman is a treat!	I stayed here with family while visiting Chicago. The rooms are clean, the bathrooms are of a decent size, and the people were wonderful. However, the doorman, Vincent, was the real treat! He greeted us, escorted us with our luggage to our room, and recommended some great places to eat (none of which included the restaurant next to the hotel.) On the way back to the airport, we decided to take the el, which drops off right in front of the hotel. He packed our bags (50 lbs each) to the platform for us!This hotel is clean, and nice. The lobby is a great place to hide out if you want to get out of your room and read. Be aware that if you're looking to spend a great amount of time in your room, there isn't much of a view - it's surrounded by buildings and the el runs right in front. Don't be too afraid of the el, though - from the rooms we were in, you couldn't hear it unless it was really quiet, and then it sounded kind of like the ocean. The location is great - it's surrounded by everything within walking distance. However, I would avoid two things: 1) The restaurant downstairs - it's pricey and not very good, and 2) Room service - it comes from the same restaurant. There's a corner bakery a 1/2 block south which does a great breakfast and lunch, or a diner called B&B's that's on the west side of the next block south that is much better and has a great breakfast special.In all, it's a pleasant place, and great if you're on vacation or planning to do other things besides sit in your room.

May 19 2009 	Not the greatest but ok	We checked into the Silversmith Hotel on Friday May 15th. We had a suite and it was spacious and suited our needs perfectly. We ordered room service the next morning so that we could sleep in a bit longer before our tour. This was most likely the worst room service I have ever had. We normally let things slide and hardly ever complain about service. They forgot one breakfast, cutlery, drinks and napkins. The food they did deliver was barely luke warm. I called down and was told that if I wanted it fixed I would have to come down to them, they only had two waiters on that morning. Finally my husband went down and the person in charge was not going to do anything to correct the error. The manager happened to walk in and when told about the problem he said he would correct the bill. To add insult to injury they automatically add an 18% gratuity to the bill. Our tour operator told me that we had a great place for breakfast and was astounded when I told her about the service we received. We checked out on Monday and the bill had not been corrected, the person at the front desk did so though. The location is good but for the money we spent I would go else where. Chicago is a great city to visit and we had a great time and good memories. I just wanted to share this so that others can avoid the problem.

May 17 2009 	Rude and Dishonest Manager	The manager lied to us. We tried to check in twice at 10am & noon. We checked our bags with the staff and were told both times that our reservation was in order but we should check in later in the afternoon. At 5:30pm, we were told that Silversmith had no room for us! They said that they could not give us a refund, because "Expedia" had our money. My sister had booked the room and prepaid in full through Hotels.com. They sent us a mile away (as we were walking everywhere, it was not a convenient location) with no compensation other than $10 for cabfare. We called Hotels.com and were told that they couldn't refund our $ because Silversmith already had it!

Apr 26 2009 	Girls Weekend - Great Hotel Choice	Booked through Groople at a decent rate (for Chicago). Was a bit worried after reading some of these reviews. But, no problem. Hotel rooms were spacious and furnished nicely. Great location, near the theaters, park, and restaurants. Only wierd thing was no glasses, only mugs, in rooms. Staff were all gracious and friendly. Kudos to Shannon, Patty and Vincent especially. Already planning next girls getaway for the same hotel.

Mar 30 2009 	Weekend Stay for a Wedding	We stayed at the Silversmith Hotel and Suites this weekend for three nights. My daughter was married nearby and we arranged with the hotel for special pricing and to save rooms. Many of us stayed there over the weekend and we also had a private brunch in one of the meeting rooms. I can't say enought about the wonderful way we were treated, the beautiful setting, and the great room. They were willing to put the families on the same floor so that we could be together, pass out gift bags to our guests and helped us with the details and emergencies that came up. The brunch was wonderful and the servers not only did a good job during the meal but also helped us find boxes to pack up our decorations afterword. I just can't say enough good things about the Silversmith!!!

Mar 29 2009 	Very pleased with the Silversmith	A very nice hotel with a wonderfully convenient location. My only real complaint would be that the hallway doors are very loud so that you hear all your neighbors comings and goings. Could get annoying with the wrong neighbors! At the moment access to the front door is awkward due to sidewalk construction but it was not a real problem. Valet parking needs 20-30 minutes advance notice to get you your car. Several alternative parking areas within two blocks.

Mar 20 2009 	Fantastic hotel	Currently staying here for two nights with family. This is a beautiful restored landmark. Hallways are beautifully decorated and clean. Our room was immaculate, well-decorated, very pleasant. The main thing to be aware of is that this is a typical urban center hotel, which means the rooms are small. It's a tight fit for two adults and two teenagers, but the location and pleasantness of the hotel make up for that.If you are driving to the hotel, be aware that there is no parking adjacent to the hotel. A valet service is available at the entrance, but you may have to call the desk or send someone inside to let them know you are outside. Currently, there's some construction on the street in front of the hotel, which makes this a bit more difficult.Overall, a wonderful place to stay. A great value in the heart of the city. It's only a short walk to the Art Institute or Millennium Park.

Mar 9 2009 	Best Kept Secret In Chicago!!	WOW!! This great hotel is the best kept secret we have found in Chicago. This is a charming place with beautiful rooms. The suite we had was great with plenty of room. A huge bathroom and beautiful bedroom were an added bonus. We surely were not expecting such a surprise. It is close to the L on Wabash but if you ask for a room toward the back you will have no problem with any noise. The rooms were large, clean and the staff were extremely friendly. The price is much more reasonable than any place we have found in Chicago. We definately will be going back when we visit Chicago again. Another convenience is the fact that it is located in the theater district so many theaters are within walking distance. Great place to stay!!

Feb 19 2009 	Nice hotel for a great price	Silversmith is tucked away on Wabash - in the center of downtown, walking distance to Millenium Park, Michigan Ave and State St. Plenty of places to eat and bars around. The room was pretty basic, but nice. The hotel itself seemed very empty, not much going on. Great place downstairs for breakfast - Adas - and drinks at the 14 Karat Lounge. Millers Pub is a few doors down - great place for drinks!

Feb 10 2009 	Wonderful Hotel	Really loved the hotel. Second time there. Paid with tax $114. My girl friend and I wanted a room with 2 beds and when we arrived at 1pm, we were told there were none available so they gave us a suite. My only regret is that we didn't spend enough time in the room to enjoy it. It was beautiful.The staff at the front desk (African American) was terrific and very helpful. Couldn't have asked for a better worker.

Feb 5 2009 	Beware!	Don't let the reviews fool you, when the low price seems too good to be true, it is. We arrived and were very disappointed with the condition of the hotel and the neighborhood, and when we saw our room we decided we were out of there. The manager, Jeremy, said that since we booked on the internet (on their website, not some third party) they would not refund our money even though we were dissatisfied and were moving. He was obviously used to having this arguments with unhappy guests. Luckily we booked with AMEX and will dispute the charges but what a terrible start to our trip to Chicago. I even offered to let them keep the money for the first night and refund the second night, but they wouldn't do it. Can't deal with people who take your money for something and won't give it back when you tell them you are unhappy and won't be using their facility.

Feb 3 2009 	Never again	It seemed like such a promising start: they had a room ready for me when I got there very early. Sure it was a queen, and I'd paid for a king, but I could put up with that.Sadly, it was all down hill from there...After heading out for the day I returned to the room for the evening and tried to set up a wake up call, but for some reason the phone in the room was set to 'rotary' and while I could hear it churning, it wasn't connecting with anyone. I gave up and set alarm on my watch and went to bed. But I couldn't sleep because of the stratchy things in the bed: turn out they were toe nail clippings. Yep, the bed had only been made after the last user, the sheets hadn't been cleaned. Disgusting.In the morning I went for a shower, but the setting on the shower head was stuck between two settings and wouldn't move. All I was getting was a dribble by the one cluster of massaging jets: the other two clusters were too full of gunk to send water out. DISGUSTING!I told the Front Desk this (again, phone not working... had to go down in person), and when I returned for my second (and thankfully last) night the shower was working properly and the phone working. And the sheets appeared to be clean. Unfortunately the rest of the bedding wasn't so good.I had noticed it was cold the previous night, but there was a major cold snap on in Chicago so I just put it down to that. That day, however, had been mild and so there shouldn't be a problem. That is when I really looked at the bedding (other than the toenail-ridden sheets) and discovered there was only one blanket on the bed. A summer-weight blanket. And the bed spread was also a summer weight blanket. Also, no extra blanket in the closet, as you'd expect in most hotels. I spent the first half of the night waking up every hour, getting up and turning the heat up in the room and then tucking myself back in and hoping it would get better. Finally, around 2 am I got up, maxed out the heating, folded the blankets over a few times and got fully dressed before returning to bed. I managed to sleep the rest of the night until my early wakeup call.When I tried to check out using the on-screen process it said that it could not be done. Great! Another stop when I am trying to rush out... I go to the front desk and am told that I couldn't check out that way because I had prepaid the hotel through a third party, and I had to pay for the incidentals. I said, yes, but I gave you a credit card for the incidentals at check in. It is the credit card that you just finished saying "should I just leave it on your ...... card?" I am treated to a lecture on how if I had gone through the hotel to book my room this wouldn't have happened. Way to punish your customers!To add insult to injury, I am coming off the elevators on the first floor and the bell man walks by, heading away from the front door. I am almost at the front door (a good 30 feet away) and I hear "Hey you! Do you want a cab?" yelled at me. No, I don't want a cab, what I want is something to help me forget the horrible stay I had at this disgusting hotel.P.S. It is a day later and I now have a major head cold. Wonder why...

Jan 25 2009 	Wonderful Experience!	I stayed for 4 nights in January. Got a great last minute rate through the hotel's website. I took the "L" from Midway airport, got off at Madison station, and was literally steps from the hotel entrance. The location absolutely cannot be beat! Hotel staff was friendly and helpful. The room was very clean, comfortable and spacious, esp. the bathroom. The noise from the "L" was not bothersome to me. I would definitely stay at the Silversmith again -- very highly recommend!

Jan 20 2009 	Great hotel and price!	My friends and I came to Chicago for a girls getaway weekend/30th birthday party. We found the Silversmith hotel on hotels.com. The price was very attractive at $80/night and the photos looked really nice. We knew we didn't need a large hotel because we wouldn't be there very much so we went with the hotel. The staff was extremely friendly upon check-in, thanking my friend three times for booking at the Silversmith. The concierge was more than helpful with our bags, hailing us cabs, welcoming us back to the hotel, wishing us a good day when we left, and giving us accurate information about the city. The room was much larger than expected and the high ceilings were a plus. The bathroom was large enough for all 3 of us to get ready in the same mirror at the same time. Most of you girls know how difficult it is to get ready at the same time in one bathroom! We found that very convenient.We are already planning our next weekend trip hopefully in April and we would book here again in a minute.There is a cafe attached to the hotel called Ada's. We ate breakfast there on Saturday morning but wouldn't recommend it due to pricing. The food was good - service was slow - but the prices were outrageous. $4.50 for ONE egg... a block to your left is Dunkin Donuts and a block to your right is McDonalds. All in all though - we were very pleased! Can't wait to come back.

Jan 10 2009 	Loved it-what happened to Housekeeping?	We (my husband and I)stayed at this hotel over the New Year holiday. The Silversmith was picked for its location to a Blues Club several blocks south on Wabash. Vincent was particularly helpful by calling a restaurant for us and helping with walking directions. No real problems, but the housekeeper never cleaned our room. Not a huge problem as we planned to re use our towels. It would have been nice to have the trash emptied. We will return despite that small problem.

Jan 4 2009 	Silversmith is Good as Gold!	Our family of 4 (2 adults, 11- and 13-year old girls) along with another family of 4, recently returned from a 2-night New Years stay at the Silversmith. We booked on Priceline...2 standard rooms were $86/night (each). Super value. Stay was excellent all the way around. Rooms and beds were very, very comfortable and spotless. Had two corner rooms at the back of the building, 4th floor. No hint of train noise (of course, our windows were closed at this time of year). Bathrooms are huge, towels plentiful, shower function was perfect. Lobby is spacious and gracious, but not overbearing. Very good coffee/tea in the a.m. Staff were polite, helpful and prompt. Walking distance (even in 25ish degree weather) to State St. shopping, Milennium Park and Mag Mile. Attentive door staff and bell captain. Good elevator security. Building itself has been carefully renovated...very lovely. Will stay here again without question. A really sweet oasis. Note: check out nearby Pizano's for delicious, cozy, family-friendly Italian and Chicago style pizza.

Dec 5 2008 	Silversmith Hotel 	If you're looking for a comfortable smaller hotel (only 140 rooms/suites), in a great location, consider the Silversmith. We just returned from a long week-end at the Silversmith, and we couldn't have been more pleased (our second visit to this hotel). We had two young granddaughters with us (7 and 9 years old), and the location was such that we didn't have to walk more than a few blocks where ever we went. Silversmith is on Wabash, which is between Michigan and State, and Monroe and Madison streets. Millennium Park is only a block from the hotel. The orange line stop is almost at the door, and the red line is about a block away. Yes, there is some noise from the orange train line, and yes, you can hear it in the room, however, we didn't find it to be a problem. During our stay we walked through one of the larger hotels, and it felt like we were in "Grand Central Station". The Silversmith lobby is spacious, warm, welcoming, and very quiet. Monday through Thursday they serve evening desserts from 8:30 p.m. to 9:30 p.m. They also have a complementary computer center which we used. We parked at the Millennium Parking Garage; cost is $22.00 for 24 hours. The parking entrance in on Columbus off Monroe, and about three blocks from Silversmith (we had no problems driving into the city). Just be certain you know exactly where you parked your car; the parking garage is huge with several entrances. The visitor center is located in the Cultural Center located at the corner of Randolph and Michigan (only two blocks from Silversmith). There is a CTA machine at the visitor's center (for multiple day transit passes), which can be used for the bus or trains. 3-day pass was $12.00 for unlimited rides. We used buses on Michigan as well as State streets, and the red line. We had a wonderful time showing our young granddaughters around Chicago, and look forward to a return visit. If you have any questions about the hotel or what we did with our two young granddaughter (don't miss the Children's Museum at Navy Pier, it was wonderful), please know I would be happy to respond. Chicago is very easy to get around, with so much to do, and by all means consider staying at the Silversmith!!

Dec 2 2008 	Great Stay	I stayed at the silversmith with my parents over the summer, and over all the hotel was a good choice.***TIP***We had a discount bc my father works for the government, you have to mention it during booking and then show proper ID, at the web site there is a part where they mention this, which is easily missed, so be sure to use this to your advantageThe hotel is practically steps away from the train stopGood and Bad depending on where ur room is, i had already read reviews mentioning this so i made a point on telling the person on the front desk to get us a room away from the train!!!At the lobby...which is very nice...there is a hidden buisness center with two computers and a printer which came in handy, so i was able to use it to print out the flight tickets and other web surfing stuff...but i must say the connection isnt that fast...but the access to computers was very convinientThe room was very clean...which is always one of my biggest concerns...and the view was not great...unless u consider looking out into an aley amusing...but overall it was goodthe bathroom was huge and that was really comfortable when you have 3 people wanting to use the sink in the morningthe beds......oh the beds....thats the only negative....there were two double beds...which really r not that comfortable for two persons to sleep in, and the beds where kind of stiff as in very stiff.....but everything cant be perfect!! at least the sheets were cleanThe hotel is at a really good location....i already mentioned the train stop....and the bus stop was i think about two blocks away....there was a wallgreens 3 or 4 blocks away...there were places to have breakfast subway, dunking donuts...a nice cafe place that i cant remember the name...and it was really really close to millenium park!!Ohhhhh!!!!! and i dont remember exactly where but i know it was to the right if u have the hotel entrance in front of u and taking a left there is Jareds!!!!! the popcorn place....u must go if u hadnt been there best popcorn!!! the cheddar one and the caramenl one are superb!!!Also...when i stayed the hotel had like a midnight snack going on...get there early and take advantage...they have cheescake, cookies, cake it was really good...the coffee...not so good , but it was nicereally overall the hotel was a good choice!!!!!

Oct 17 2008 	Ok to stay but difficult to get into...	Let me start with something positive: the location. Aug 4 2008 	Fantastic Hotel	The Silversmith Hotel was in my humble opinion a fantastic place to stay. Aug 4 2008	Too noisy	We booked two rooms for one night through Travelocity for $206 per room, including taxes. When we checked in, the hotel had reserved one room for 2 nights. The Self Park at 55 East Monroe (about 1.5 blocks away) is the nearest, I believe. I paid $63 for 28 hours at the Self Park so I wished I had used the valet service. The staff was friendly & helpful. Jul 9 2008 	Never fails	This was the second time my husband and I stayed at the Silversmith, and we will continue to stay here, as long as the hotels standards are maintained to the present high level,the location is wonderful and the rooms are spotless and very comfortable, and decorated in neutral tones which is very relaxing, just what is needed after a long day shopping and sight seeing, only one slight snag on our second stay, we were given a room Instead of the suite I had booked, but this was swiftly corrected, this hotel is excellent value for money and I would not hesitate in recommending it to anyone. Jun 11 2008 	An Excellent Place	We stayed here for four days in June 08. This was probably one of the best hotels we have ever stayed in. We were a little concerned about some of the previous reviews concerning the train noise, but did not experience it. The entrance to the hotel is only a single door and small canopy on the west side of Wabash, so it is easy to miss. The lobby is up the elevators on the 2nd floor. Rooms start on the 3rd floor. The hotel is horseshoe shaped, open to the south, and our room was on the inside. There are about 15 rooms per floor. On our floor (6th), rooms 601-605 faced east to Wabash, and the 'L' train is right outside, so I would avoid those, especially on the lower floors. The only train & street noises we heard, and only when the A/C was off, was a short, muffled, 10 second sound every few minutes, kind of like what you hear sitting in the airport terminal when a plane takes off in the distance. The room was fantasic. Very tastefully decorated in classic Frank Lloyd Wright art deco style. The details of the room were absolutely perfect, like is was completed yesterday. Houskeeping was extraordinary. The bed was very comfortable, but the pillows were thin. All of the staff was very nice and professional. An overall excellent experience! You have to eat breakfast at the Pittsfield Cafe, in the lobby of the Pittsfield Bldg, one block north of the opposite side of Wabash. Closed on Sundays. How about two eggs, bacon, & two big pancakes for $5.55? We will stay here again on our next trip. The train to/from O'Hare stops 2 blocks west (Madison) and costs $1.75 from the airport. Hope you have as great of a stay as we did.

This hotel was found by reading online reviews of about 40 hotels in the downtown Chicago district. I had stayed at two of the major hotels, meaning large chains, on prior trips and was looking for something a bit different. The reviews that people write are difficult to understand at times, especially the ones that had written about not finding the front entrance to the hotel. It couldn't be more obvious! Flags flying overhead with the name Silversmith printed on them, and the brass in-lay on the threshold as you open the front door reads SILVERSMITH! This hotel offered so much style, character, and class throughout. I stayed for 2nights, during the week. The room, with 2 double beds, was gorgeous, and roomy....very roomy! Ceilings were 12 feet tall, and there was plenty of closet space, a frig to use with bottled water in it, big screen TV, and a gorgeous bathroom with marble everywhere and white robes! I will stay here again. It was right around the corner from the theatre showing Jersey Boys. The L was NOT, in any way, a huge noise issue. Slept great as the beds and linen were first rate. Staff and help all very helpful! Am looking forward to another stay in December!

Mar 3 2008 	What a nice suprise!	We just stayed at the Silversmith this past weekend... What a great place! We decided to stay here at the last minute, so we preparing to make the best of our rushed unplanned situation. Imagine our surprise to find that the Silversmith is actually a very pleasant place! The room was more than comfortable and very well kept, and the staff was very helpful and polite. I'm glad we decided to give it a try. FYI: It's easy to drive by the entrance; It's very close to the corner of South Wabash and Madison.

Feb 27 2008 	Great room great location great service	The Silversmith was a wonderful find through Tripadvisor for a girls weekend in Chicago! We all went to college in Chicago and know the area well so a hotel in the loop was very convenient. After reading reviews of other hotels we decided to spend a little bit more for a hotel that goes just beyond the basics, to make sure we weren't in mold, mildew and bad service. What we got was much more! Upon checking in, the room we requested, two double beds, was not availble in non-smoking so we had the option to have a suite with a pull-out bed. We took it and were very pleased. The room was spacious with two small closets, two TVs and a very spacious bathroom with plenty of lighting and a large, beautiful granite counter top and imported toiletries. A wired internet was available at the desk and offered a quick connection, although wireless was not available in the room.The El stop is just outside the hotel and we walked to Michigan Avenue, Millennium Park, Auditorium Theatre, Macys and more. We only took a taxi to save time when traveling far.I asked for assistance on two occasions and the hotel did not fail. Upon my late arrival on a Friday night after 11 PM I asked for a late-night restaurant recommendation and the front desk suggested a few in the area. When I mentioned that I was pregnant and looking for a milkshake he offered to walk to the store and bring it back for me! When I checked out and asked the doorman for the closest El stop to the O'Hare blue line, with an elevator, he thought for a while and could not think of a stop with an elevator. The valet parking guy was next to him and said there was only one flight of stairs at the stop 3 blocks away and he volunteered to walk me there and even took my bags down the street and down the stairs. This was a very kind gesture, and I don't think he even noticed that I was pregnant.

Feb 5 2008	Good experience until we got the bill	We had a wonderful experience with the hotel and staff until we received our credit card bill. Our bill at check-out time was correct but when we received our credit card bill they charged us twice for one night during our stay. After about 2 weeks of calling the hotel and conveniently the person that we needed to talk to was never there and never returned any of our messages, we finally turned it over to our credit card company to take care of, thankfully it was on our American Express. It is now February and we stayed at the Silversmith in November and the credit card company has still not been able to reach anyone at the hotel who can resolve the charge.I wouldn't recommend staying here unless you are willing to pay double price, in the already overpriced hotel.

Feb 3 2008	Great Weekend Experience	My son and I spent a Saturday night at this hotel. We were in Chicago checking out SAIC and this proved to be an ideal locaton to walk to the Art Institute of Chicago as well as Millenium Park. Extremely easy to take the train from OHare to a stop no more than three or four blocks from the hotel.Hotel was clean, attractive, and the staff where competent. The staff at the front entrance gave us lots of good advice on food and getting around. Great experience overall. I plan to go back sometime to visit Chicago with the rest of my family and will stay at this hotel.

Jan 26 2008 	Solid service good rooms	I'd stayed here about a year ago, but I just had my first stay since the Silversmith became independent. All was fine; the room (916) was clean and had a great bed, the front desk folks and bellhops were courteous and attentive, and the internet worked fine (though not wireless). I also paid for several rooms for my colleagues and the front desk made the process easy.The location is fine although it's right under the El tracks; request a room away from the train if you're concerned about the noise (I was on the opposite side of the hotel and didn't hear anything).

Jan 21 2008	Great Location for Weekend Shopping Trip	While not located in as glamourous an area as the N. Michigan Ave hotels, the Silversmith was a very positive experience. All shopping was within walking distance - the State St. shopping area was right at our doorstep. Excellent location also for theater, cultural and Soldier Field. Staff was very friendly and helpful. On site deli was convenient and hotel bar was lots of fun; it was nice not to have to venture outside on frigid January nights to have a nice evening out. The train noise which I had read about in other reviews was present, but more of a distant background noise which did not keep us awake at night. We took the advice of locals we met at the bar not to venture more than a few blocks south of the hotel.

Jan 2 2008 	Great find	Great hotel and location. This hotel is on Wabash, a couple of blocks from Michigan Avenue. If you don't mind walking (which if you are visiting Chicago, it is assumed you will be doing a lot of walking), the location is great. It is attached to a deli which has a wonderful menu. Even if we don't stay at this hotel next time we visit, we would definitely eat at "Adas Famous Deli and Restaurant ." Check in was a breeze. Our room was very clean and roomy, however we were located directly over the El tracks and it was very noisy. We went back to the front desk and asked to be moved and they were very nice and moved us to another room away from the El. We had a suite and it turns out they upgraded us to a larger suite. Each staff member we encountered was very polite and courteous. We would definitely stay at this hotel again.

Dec 18 2007 	Lovely boutique hotel	We stayed at the Silversmith in October. Yes, there was construction out front but the location can't be beat and we got a fabulous rate. I believe they said construction was supposed to be completed by Nov. 15 but call to make sure.It holds an old world sort of charm. The rooms were nice size with tall celings and the bathroom is HUGE! There were plenty of pillows and towels which can sometimes a problem at other hotels. The staff was sweet and attentive and don't forget Dessert Night w/cheesecake and sweets. YUMMY!If the price is right, I will definitely stay there again.

Dec 12 2007 	Great Small Hotel	I booked the Silversmith on a special rate and was pleasantly surprised that they upgraded us to a suite. The room was very nice and quiet. We were on the 10th floor and could hear the EL train as only a low rumble. I can see where someone on a lower floor might be bothered by the noise. The bell captain and the front desk attendants were very nice and very helpful with questions. The location is close to Macy's and within walking distance of the Art Institute and other places. We would definitely stay there again.

Nov 28 2007 	Mold and Mildew Problem!	I really wanted to like this property and, I wanted to wait for a response from the hotel before I wrote my review but, 3 weeks later and no response.The Silversmith is a beautiful property in a very convenient location with a gret bar and deli on the property. The room and bath were large and nicely updated but we just couldn't get past the horrible smell in the room. This was not the 'room closed too long and a little musty' smell. This was a 'knock you to the floor when you open the door' smell! Overpowering mold and mildew stink! We told the front desk as soon as we checked in but they had no other rooms available. We asked that it be cleaned or sprayed and they said yes but, when we returned from dinner it appeared to be exactly as we left it. We went across the street to CVS and purchased 2 cans of Lysol spray and attacked the bath, carpet, drapes, bedding, etc. then left for the evening. We returned to a slightly better smelling room but, really, got very little sleep all night.Mold can raise very serious health problems for many people with any kind of respritory issues and should be taked very seriously! I understand that issues occur when you are running a business but what really bothered me is the way we were just waved off with no compensation or appologies. The staff was polite but ineffective in offering any type of resolution to this problem - even after I completed the 2 surveys they sent me - no response from the hotel what so ever!When booking a 4 star hotel such as the Silversmith, you should be guarenteed a clean and comfortable room. The Silversmith did not meet my expectations for the basics and my valid complaint was not handled well at all.

Nov 27 2007 	Great hotel!	This place is great. The rooms are huge and well-appointed and very well-maintained. Great service, friendly staff. I would definitely go back and recommend to all my friends. Loved it!

Nov 15 2007 	great hotel poor view	We stayed one night at the Silversmith and asked for a quiet room after reading the TripAdvisor reviews. The room was exceptionally quiet but the view out the window was a brick wall. The room was cleanand the bedding very nice. The bellhop, front desk, and conciere were very friendly. We booked through Hotwire and paid $89 which for downtown Chicago is a great deal. One hint is to watch for the entrance on the right hand side of the one way street. It is not an easy hotel to find.

Nov 6 2007	Don't stay here if you have any choice.	I would not stay at this hotel again under any circumstances.I was given a card key to my room. However when I got there, it was clearly occupied. Fortunately the person was not in the room at the time, however it was quite unsettling and the hotel had no understanding of why this might bother me. I asked what steps would be taken to insure that nobody would then go into my room. None were given.I was supposed to be in a suite. It was a room. The street is sketchy, and while there are hotel security personnel on the first floor at times, there is no 24 hour coverage. We came back late from a business meeting to find nobody there. Anybody could have followed us into the elevator at the second floor.When my colleague phoned downstairs to arrange a wake up call, nobody answered. This despite the fact that I had called for one seconds before she did. The street construction makes it difficult to get dropped off with bags and the El is noisy to say the least. Do not stay in this hotel if you have any possible options.

Nov 6 2007	Not Recommended	There is still construction going on in front of the hotel, making it difficult to find the valet. L-Train runs right outside the hotel - not sure how it could be listed as 4-star hotel with the noise? Aftercheckin we went to our non-smoking room to find someone had just been smoking in the room. We went downstairs to the receptionist torequest another room and were told there were no other rooms available. She insisted that we got what we reserved "a non-smoking room." And would not conceed that it was the hotel's problem that someone had just smoked in the room. She offered to spray the room down - but we wouldn't be able to enter the room for an hour. At this point it was 11pm and we were tired from traveling. When we told her we wanted to cancel the room she said we would not get a refund, even though it was the hotel's problem they are not enforcing the no smoking policy. We eventually got a refund through hotels.com, but theSilversmith could use a lesson in hotel management and customer service.

Oct 17 2007 	The Silversmith Is An Excellent Choice	We just returned from a long weekend getaway to The Silversmith. After researching the many hotel options in Chicago we settled on the Silversmith for location, value and overall features. When we arrived there was some confusion regarding the room type we were assigned (a standard double) versus the room type we had booked (a suite). Unfortunately there were no suites available for our first night. The manager on duty, Jeremy, was very apologetic and blocked a suite for our remaining 3 nights. He also offered us breakfast at the hotel restaurant for our inconvenience. Since we are a family of four, with college/high school children, this was a reasonable compensation. After breakfast the next morning (which was very good) we moved to our suite which was excellent (featuring a very large bathroom which apparently is not the norm for downtown Chicago). The staff was very friendly and accomodating. The general manager, Jason was very responsive to our needs and also apologetic for our first night inconvenience. Peggy, the concierge, was very knowledgeable, helpful and friendly (calling us all by name after our first meeting). The room was clean and housekeeping was respectful of our schedule. The beds were extremely comfortable and the toiletries were first class. The location is outstanding, within walking distance to shopping, parks and a convenient cab or train ride to many other attractions. The lobby is comfortable and relaxing. I enjoyed the complimentary coffee and paper each morning. The dessert reception the evening we arrived was a nice touch (the cheesecake was delicious). The only negative is really beyond the hotel's control - construction. The sidewalk is torn up in front of the hotel making it a bit difficult to find and unattractive from the exterior. However, I understand that when it is completed it will resemble the look of Michigan and State Streets which are on wither side of Wabash. Even with the construction I would stay at the Silversmith again. It was a minor inconvenience. If you are looking for a good value in a great location with a comfortable, unpretentious setting and the personal attention characteristic of a boutique style hotel this is an excellent choice.

Oct 15 2007 	Terrific Hotel	After seeing the other reviews for October here, I can't believe that we were in the same hotel. The Silversmith Hotel where I stayed on October 11 &12, was clean, stylish, well maintained and the staff was wonderful. The only down point was the shower flow restrictor was too restrictive. The attached restaurant/bar was also delightful with great people watching and generous drinks. Tom the Bartender is great and always on top of whats going on.People should understand that this hotel is not a brand new Westin or Omni. This is a charming Grand Hotel in the style of warmth and charm, not brass and glass.The beds were comfortable and the room was a good size with great high ceilings. I was on the backside of the hotel and didn't hear any train noise at all. The location is perfect for sight seeing and transportation to any area of Chicago.All in all, it is a Grand Old Hotel and well worth a visit

Oct 2 2007 	Great Stay - Super Location	We just got back from our stay. I had read some reviews and was a little concerned about problems with the reservation based on some of the prior reviews. When we checked in, they thought we were only staying 1 day while we were staying two but they corrected it quickly and with no problems. The room was fabulous. Yes, we could hear a faint rumble of the train but certainly not enough to detract from the room.The location was perfect being so close to both Millenium Park and various train stations. The player piano in the lobby was nice. It would have been nice to be able to get a drink in the hotel somehwere. The restaurant was OK although my husband loved it as he was able to get a sandwich for breakfast.We would not hesitate to book a stay there in the future.

Sep 2 2007 	Chicago and the Silversmith Hotel made a perfect mini-vacation.	I found and booked a three night stay at the Silversmith Hotel for the last weekend of July through Travelzoo.com. We loved the location downtown and the conveinence to Millenium Park and the transportation options. When we first saw the hotel we thought it might be a little noisy because it is located next to the elevated train downtown loop. Our King Suite on the eighth floor facing the elevated station was very quite and exceeded our expectations in every way. The room was large, clean and modern with a large bathroom, very nice furniture and a great bed that made us feel pampered. The staff was friendly and helpful and made our stay very enjoyable. The hotel lobby was functionable and nice but not a place where you would want to hang out very long, and the fitness center was small but adaquate. I did bring my laptop and was never able to get a wireless connection. It might of helped if I had asked the front desk for assistance. Overall we had a excellent experience at the Silversmith and would recommend it to everyone.

Aug 30 2007 	Great Value	We had a great experience at The Silversmith. Reading the reviews we asked for a quiet room away from the El and I guessed received it as we barely heard it. The construction was a little awkward getting in but that's certainly not the hotel's fault and it's really not that bad. Everyone was very nice and helpful. The room was great. Very clean room, comfortable bed, large bathroom and high ceilings. A really nice room and great value for the price. Centrally located and close to most that Chicago has to offer. Called for some additional coffee and it was brought very promptly. Upon checkout we asked the bellman if he could hold our bags for a few hours. He jokingly said we had 30 days and after that the hotel would have to claim them. Just a nice friendly touch. Based on our experience I would highly recommend The Silversmith. It's our new home when in Chicago. And with our daughter and son-in-law there that will be pretty often.

Aug 29 2007 	Hidden gem!	I received a notice that the hotel was offering a special rate on rooms for August and I booked online with no problem. This hotel is great. It is in a good loop location with access to the buses and trains and the room was wonderful. Plenty of light, big bathroom, great amenities and comfortable beds. The staff is responsive and very pleasant and even though the hotel is right by the "L" train, you cannot hear a thing in the hotel room. I would highly recommend you consider this hotel when looking for a place to stay in Chicago.

Aug 23 2007 	Very disappointed in their customer service	My family and I stayed at the Silversmith on August 18th booking our room several weeks in advance through the hotel website. I had stayed on past occasions and found it to be a nice experience. When we arrived, we found the hotel entrance blocked by construction requiring us to be on the opposite side of the street to access valet parking..a trip around several blocks in traffic but it was accomplished. The valet had the bell person come from the hotel while we waited in the rain. Not a big deal. We were given our hotel room and when we arrived it seemed warm. I attempted to call the front desk but there was no answer. We thought perhaps it just needed more time but when we returned from a wedding later in the evening it was very hot. It took two tries to get the front desk but they sent up a bellman who looked at it and said it must be broken. He said there was no one around to fix it. When I asked to be put in another room, I was told rudely that they were full and there was nothing they could or would do. My mother, who has respiratory problems had to sit up all night, struggling to breathe. When I checked out the next day, I asked to speak to the manager. There wasn't one on duty. I was given a card to call later. The manager said that they would make a small adjustment in the bill..not adequate to cover the discomfort that the broken air conditioning caused...overall, the attitude was that if they are full, then they really don't care if their customers have had a satisfactory experience. I asked to be forwarded to another manager. I was forwarded to a voicemail and have still not received a response. I have used this hotel for business in the past but based on their behavior..won't be again.. To their credit, the bell staff were helpful, prompt and courteous.

Aug 15 2007 	A Good Deal for the Money	They are currently doing construction outside the hotel and to be honest, the entrance a bit obscure. When looking for it, I turned the corner from Madison to Wabash and drove right by the valet, which is RIGHT around the corner. Had to go around again. Couldn't even see the hotel because of the construction fences but the valet pointed us to the hotel, thankfully.Doormen were very friendly, though they didn't seem very informed. We asked them where we could buy a day pass for the El and the first doorman told us a place to try. Then he said, "Well, they might not be open," and then he asked the other doorman. That man gave conflicting information entirely, and finally they decided to call the front desk. No one answered so we went up to find out ourselves. Again, we got different information than either of the doormen gave. In the end we opted to pay the $2.00 fare for a one way ticket.Positives: Rooms were clean. We opted for a suite, which was only a few dollars more than a standard room. We were happy with the choice and happy to have a little extra room. Big bathrooms. Warm blankets. Peggy at the front desk is very helpful and accomodating. Previous reviews say that the El is noisy but we had a room on the inside and it was generally quiet. The whoosh of the El was still heard but it wasn't clanging like other people claimed. I'd ask for a room on the inside and you'll be fine. Location is great! El is right outside. There is a bakery one block down, a pizza place one block up, and Millenium Park is practically across the street. Walk about 5 blocks and you get into Michigan Avenue shopping. How can you complain about that for the price?A few of the negatives: a phone in the room didn't work, a light in the room didn't work. When I called Housekeeping using the "Housekeeping" button on the phone, they said they would bring me two more towels as I requested. 25 minutes later, no towels. I called Housekeeping. No answer. I called the front desk and repeated my request. Towels were brought to me immeadiately. If you're in Chicago for Business or to see a show, this hotel is right in the heart of it. If you want to shop, you might try to get a little closer. If you don't mind walking a little, you can't beat the price.

Aug 15 2007 	Wonderful location and staff	My brother works in Chicago and recommended this hotel. It was our first visit to Chicago and we felt immediately welcomed by the staff there. It's in the loop, with great restaurants all around and very convenient to all public transporation. You don't need to struggle with transit maps, just ask the doorman for help getting to any part of the city. Two blocks away you can have coffee at Centennial Park, two blocks more and you are on the "Magnificent Mile" (though I don't know what's so great about it-- while the architecture is beautiful it's nothing more than an outdoor mall).The bed was perfect, the bathroom large and clean, the evening dessert buffet (free Mon. thru Thurs.) delicious and the concierge extremely helpful.Only problem would be if you had a room in the front of the hotel, as those rooms look out over the elevated train which is very noisy.

Aug 13 2007 	I'd stay here again in a heartbeat!!!!	I was so thrilled with my stay there last weekend I had to make sure I put in a good word for this hotel! We went there expecting less than perfection but I can't make one complaint about it unless you count that the entry into the hotel is a little hard to find with the construction fence at the curb. I had to call the front desk to find the valet parking across the street but once I did, it was a piece of cake. Everyone there is friendly, courteous and helpful. All I can say to those who had negative things to say about the staff is maybe you get what you give. We paid an extremely low price based on a Travel Ticker special ($89!) and I expected to get not the best room. Instead of a king room we had a suite (similar to Embassy with a much bigger bathroom) on the 5th floor. It was overlooking the construction and the el but the soft whoosh of the el was not in anyway disturbing. Everything in the room was clean and fresh and the fridge with bottled water was a nice touch. I thought the Mission style was perfect and very relaxing. Even though there was a family with small children on our floor we never heard any noise from other rooms. The hotel location is superb ...tons of shopping, theaters and restaurants just a short walk away. I had to drive several times and never had a bit of trouble getting my car out when I needed it. I really love this place and I have stayed at several nice Michigan Avenue hotels in the last few years. If I can get anywhere close to the price I paid (instead of the $229 quoted on most sites that list this hotel) I will pack my bags again! I LOVED it!

Aug 8 2007 	Great Hotel Great Location Good Value	This is my second stay at the Silversmith Hotel. I love this hotel. It is located one block from Millenium Park, Michigan Avenue, Lots of Shopping. Super comfortable rooms and beds. The Cheesecake Dessert at night in the lobby is fantastic, and FREE! The staff is very friendly. NOTE: There is a lot of construction going on directly in front of the hotel, but once inside you hardly knew anything was going on. I paid just over 200.00 for my room, ( AAA discount available ) and compared to the other chain hotels in the area like Hilton, Sheraton, etc, they were all over 300.00 and more. Be sure to request a room away from the Train for a good nights rest. I will definitely stay here again.
Aug 7 2007 	Fantastic	Beautiful, elegant, well appointed room. Huge. Wonderfully large bathroom. We have only good things to say about the Silversmith. Will definitely stay there again.

Aug 7 2007 	Excellent value excellent location	I was attending a conference at the Palmer House Hilton this May. The conference rate for the Palmer was more than my employer was willing to pay ($250). So my travel agent found the Silversmith, just around the corner, for a much lower price (about $130).I was prepared for a more 'budget' experience, perhaps even a somewhat seedy one given the price differential, but I was pleasantly surprised. The Silversmith is a very a nicely appointed hotel, and a considerable bargain in that neighborhood. My room was lovely - large enough to get some work done in, a nice comfortable bed, a huge bathroom. It was both larger and considerably nicer than a similarly priced Comfort Inn I'd stayed in on a previous business trip to Chicago. Unlike other reviewers who have complained of noise, I didn't experience any disturbances.The location is great - right in the Loop, and right under the El - excellent access to public transit. I also had no difficulty catching a cab. Overall a great experience for the price, and if I was returning to Chicago again for work, I would definitely return.

Jul 31 2007 	Once Past The Wow Factor	The property sucks you in & then, when given a little time, the flaws start to show.I was at the Silversmith from 27-29 July 2007 for a wedding in the city (though no festivities took place in the hotel).The Silversmith is no doubt a beautiful hotel, especially in the common areas. The woodwork in the lobby is very nice. My room (# 314) was spacious but had a rather unfortunate view of a back alley (instead of the noisy El), which meant that trash bins were being clanged around at all hours of the night. Once you have a little time you realize that its not as spectacular as you thought when you first entered. You notice that the blankets are a little frayed around the edges, that a button or two wont work on the TV remote, that some of the finish work in the bathroom needs touching up, that the concierge gives you wrong directions to a restaurant, that the heavy drapes dont quite block out all the light from the spotlights in the alleyOne thing you would expect in such a hotel would be a nicer restaurant than what is on site. Adas is just what it advertises  a deli, & one with decent food. However, there is no quiet place to sit with a drink of have a quiet conversation or a knock-your-socks-off meal. I guess the Silversmith gave up on trying to compete with Michigan Ave for the food scene  what a shame, as they could charge more, get better reviews, & actually compete with other hotels in the area like the Palmer House & the University Club.I would strongly recommend the bar in the hotel called the 14 Karat Lounge. Though loud & packed with people, its a welcome respite from a hard day in the city. Tom is a phenomenal bartender who can mix a heck of a drink, give better directions & suggestions than the concierge, & gives you all the courtesies of a regular after you place your first order.I, like others, had some issues with reservations. After they failed to email the reservations 3 times I insisted they fax the reservations to me. It was received shortly thereafter & there were no problems at check-in.I would stay at the Silversmith again, but the price would be a consideration, as there are other hotels in the area that may not be as nice but offer similar amenities at a reduction in cost. The location of the Silversmith is ideal, with Michigan Ave one block away & a public parking garage a half block away on E Monroe saves you from the $37+tip valet fee you would be charged.

Jul 17 2007 	Happily Surprised	Booked this hotel through Priceline, so I didn't choose the hotel when I booked, it got assigned to me, which always makes me a bit worried! And then I had read mixed reviews here, so I wasn't sure what to expect. But I must say I was very happy...my room (404) was huge...I guess it was a suite, though that isn't what I had booked. They had ran out of baby cots, so they sent someone out to another hotel to get us one! The noise from the EL was there as others had noted, but didn't bother me as I had brought earplugs...other then that, it was absolutely quiet, clean and in a great location. Great breakfast at the Corner Bakery next door, plus the EL stops right in front of the hotel.

Jul 15 2007 	A Hidden Gem	In Chicago for the LATE RIDE midnight 25-mile bicycle event, we wanted a hotel that was affordable and close to Grant Park, where the course begins and ends. We also wanted a hotel that wouldn't have a problem with us bringing our bicycles into our room. (Yes, last year, the hotel we stayed at would not let us bring the bikes into our room and we worried about them being stolen the entire time.) We booked a King Suite and were upgraded to a King Whirlpool Suite at check-in. After the bicycle ride, I was so grateful for that free tub! We absolutely loved the hotel's Frank Lloyd Wright motif. Our only "problem" was a long line at check-in. The problem was that the woman infront of us was upgraded, free of charge, to a better room and she couldn't understand that it was actually free. Yes, lady, this is something that hotels sometimes do because they overbook. Take the room and move on. We had our *active* toddler daughter with us, so after hearing this woman debate the free room issue for 15 minutes, we just wanted to get our key card and get it to the room. The room - WOW! We've traveled a lot and we've never had a room this nice for what we paid. The ceilings and windows were high. Breathtaking. We didn't want to leave the room come check out time. Hell, it was larger than our first apartment. The bathroom was huge. Shower, whirlpool tub, robes, thick and juicy towels. Bed was comfortable. I would have liked more blankets, but that's because I am a blanket person. No complaints from my daughter and husband. Room service was expensive, but it is at every other hotel as well. Free bottled water in mini-fridge was a nice touch. Great door men at the enterance. This is our hotel from now on for ALL our Chicago trips. (We come down often for cycling events.)

Jul 13 2007	Great location	We two ladies of a "certain age" planned a long weekend in Chicago in April, 2007. Travelzoo had a special for the Silversmith so as usual I checked out the TripAdvisor reviews. They were quite mixed but we decided to make reservations anyway since they had a good rate of $139 for a suite with 2 double beds. When we arrived from Midway a double/double suite was not available until the next day (there was a conference at the hotel) but they gave us our choice of a room with 2 double beds or a king suite for $60. We chose the King suite which had a bathroom as big as a typical european hotel room but the sofa bed was not very comfortable. The next day we moved to a suite with double beds which was very nice with a sitting room with two comfortable chairs/foot stools & large TV. The El is very close & easy to navigate from Midway. We could hear the trains but it was more like "white noise". The bar downstairs was fun but lots of smokers so we weren't able to stay there long. Ada's, the deli was good for simple food, breakfast, etc. but Murphy's down the street was a great old non-smoking place with really good food. We walked to the Chase Auditorium for a taping of a PBS radio show and the two day tourist pass allowed us on all the public transportation to the Navy Pier, The Water Tower, Midway Airport and the train station on the last day. All in all a very pleasant adventure. I will agree that the hotel's reservation system could use some improvement but Brian at the hotel's desk was very helpful in making sure we were comfortable. If we could get another great rate I would definitely stay there again.

Jul 11 2007	Our Downtown favorite	We have been going to Silversmith for several years and have found it to be a great place to stay. The location is close to everything. We live in the suburbs and know the downtown area and we choose to go to Silversmith when we want to spend time in the city. We have been there at all times of the year and have never had a complaint. The area is very safe at night too.

Jul 7 2007 	great location but bring earplugs!	got this hotel for $80/night. it had a great location, only 1 block from the art institute and very close to the taste of chicago food festival. it's only 1 block to the "el" for anyone needing public transportation. the staff was very courteous and the room was larger than what we've stayed in before. the bathroom was large and the towels were fluffy. if i had any complaint, it would be that you can hear every door shutting and that was very annoying to me as a light sleeper.

Jun 23 2007 	Good location beware the reservation/rate system ...	Great location near Michigan Ave/Loop Area, Art Institute, Symphony Center, Millennium Park, the El, etc ...
