What a wonderful way to be welcomed, I thought.I had a few things I wanted to do while in Chicago, and so I went downstairs to the Concierge and met Stephanie. Now any of you who have read back reviews from folk who have stayed at The Talbott will recall that many people praised Stephanie as a wonderful host, and Concierge. Well, I cannot say enough about her. I spent the better part of 40 minutes chatting with her about what kind of restaurants i wanted to try (it was my birthday) and other things i wanted to do. She took notes, went online and showed me different restaurants that she could recommend, called them up to make reservations as I was sitting there, and mae a couple reservations at those that the times were amenable to me. I ate at the RL restaurant (yes, Ralph Lauren), and was personally greeted when I walked in. I asked them how did you know my name, and they replied that Stephanie had called them to let them know I was coming over. I was overwhelmed...I had never experienced such special attention at any other hotel. They comped me on my desert, since Stephanie had told them it was my birthday, and all in all, I had a wonderful time. I told her that i wanted to go see a Jazz or Blues show and she pointed me to the Backroom, a few blocks away from the hotel. She looked in her draw and found me a ticket for free entrance to the show (normally $20 at the door). The concert was great, and I was there for nearly 3 hrs, drinking and enjoying the music. The place is small, intimate, but the sound is great, so it is a good place to enjoy a show.Everyone at The Talbott was gracious, smiling and helpful. I felt like I was staying with family....I cannot explain it any other way. Every morning I would come down and chat with Stephanie for a few minutes about what I was doing that day, and she suggested other things that i might do also. It was like a well-choreographed show!!!The location is perfect, near to Rush Street and the bars, restaurants and stores, Michigan Avenue is about a block and a 1/2 away.....there are buses, free trolleys so there is no problem to get where you want to go.In my stay in Chicago I had purchased a few items that could not be packed in my carry-on, and so i asked Stephanie if the Hotel could arrange for the stuff to be sent via UPS to my home. No problem, she said. I gave them my address etc....and all was arranged. I received the items aboout 4 days later.I really was sorry to leave. It was such a wonderful experience. Time and time again while I was sitting with Stephanie other folk would come in and thank her for reservations she had made for them, recommendations for theatre, restaurants, walking tours, etc....and would turn to me while I was sitting there and tell me that they always come back to The Talbott because of her. Some brought in small gifts of their appreciation....I have never seen this at any other hotel I have stayed at.I have to say that I did initially have some trepidation when i booked this hotel. I was not familiar with smaller, boutique-styled hotels, but I was sooo pleasantly surprised that I would feel as if I betrayed them if I were to ever re-visit Chicago and not stay at The Talbott. My trip was that special. That, I can safely say, is the kind of experience that makes it very easy to return time and time again to a hotel.I can safely recommend The Talbott to anyone who is looking for a different type of hotel stay....one that does not revolve around a large, Business-type place (Hilton, Hyatt etc...not that I am knocking them). I cannot wait to return to the Talbott, I was that moved by my time there.

May 31 2008 	Great small hotel fabulous location excellent service staff large rooms	We enjoyed the Talbott very much. Larger than average room and bathroom, comfortable bed, service staff well trained without being "snooty." Fabulous location on Delaware, two blocks from Michigan Ave. The downstairs Bice Bistro was superb for every course, morning through late night and there is a Starbucks directly across the street. A small hotel with great charm. Will definitely stay here again.

May 15 2008 	Very nice!	We were booked at the Talbott via Hotwire at a very good rate. We had some concerns after reading the reviews on tripadvisor, particularly about the construction noise.First, let me say the staff is outstanding, the rooms are beautiful and we would not hesitate staying there again. Stephanie, the concierge, is very, very good and made a huge impact on our stay. The hotel is relatively small but very, very upscale.Second, we found no more noise at the hotel than any other big city establishment. We were on the 11th floor and the construction was much higher and was not objectionable.Third, the location was perfect for us as we could walk to all the sights and restaurants. All the restauants on Rush St. are about a 3 block walk. Stephanie got us reservations at two marvelous spots. The Hancock Tower, where we enjoyed late night drinks, is also about a 3 block walk.The ONLY negative is you have to call room service to get ice. This is one nice hotel.

Apr 30 2008 	Kudos to the staff--they couldn't be nicer	My boyfriend and I stayed here for one night at the tail end of our trip after 3 nights in the Hilton on South Michigan. For the price we paid (approx. $160 on Hotwire), we had an excellent stay and wouldn't hesitate to recommend this property to anyone else. Compared to the Hilton, the room was probably 1.5 to 2 times as large, with a huge flat panel TV on the wall. The amenities were Aveda products, the room was clean, and the location (in the Gold Coast, only a couple of blocks from the Magnificent Mile and probably on 4 blocks to the closest El stop) was excellent. Most importantly, everyone we encountered--from the doorman to the belllman to the frontdesk clerk to the housecleaning staff-- were genuinely friendly and willing to accommodate us or answer our questions, Just one small example: we checked out of the Hilton at 11 am and took a cab to the Talbott. We just wanted to stow our bags so that we could grab something to eat, but were informed that if we were willing to wait 20 minutes or so, our room would be available! I thought our stay at the Hilton was adequate, but highly doubt we would have been able to check into our room at 11:30--and even if we could, I suspect they would have charged us for this privilege/convenience! (Mind you, the S. Michigan Hilton is happy to stow your bags for you--for only $2 per bag for the convenience. Look up other Tripadvisor reviews if you don't believe me!) Lastly, many of the reviews preceding mine complain about the construction noise, which we didn't encounter. (We were on the 15th floor, so that might have something to do with it.) So although there was a hellish amount of construction going on around and in front of the Talbott, the room itself seemed to be well insulated and caccooned off from any street noise. Again, I highly recommend this hotel. Our thanks go out especially to Jennifer and Perry for making our brief stay pleasant and enjoyable.

Apr 23 2008	Great hotel but too much construction noise.	A fantastic hotel overall, with probably the best service that I've ever experienced. The huge drawback, however, is the construction that is occurring on both sides of the hotel. They generally work 8am - 8pm Mon-Sat (we stayed for a week) and one of the buildings had workers present on Sunday as well. This was not disclosed on any part of the website at the time of booking. This hotel will be perfect when the construction's done, though the doorman at the hotel when we left estimated that they'd be working for another 1-2 years.

Mar 28 2008 	Good value and location--when the construction in the area is complete	I booked the Talbott Hotel for a two night stay in Chicago. I chose it because they offered the best rates for a 4 star hotel in the location I was looking for (convenient to shopping and dining). The positives: a nice staff, large rooms, clean and well maintained. The negatives: major construction taking place immediately next door to the hotel--sleeping past 7 a.m. was not possible and needless to say, my three teens did not like this at all. When I booked my reservation, I had inquired about construction noise and was told that it was not a factor anymore and that they had not received any comments/complaints from guests about the noise. I would not hesitate to stay here when construction is complete. It's not hip, fancy or luxurious, but charming and well-located at a price that represents a fair value--when the construction is complete.

Mar 24 2008	Second time Around	We stayed at the Talbott in February. I wrote a review but it wasn't listed. I wonder why? Fine hotel but there is construction next door that runs 6 days a week - 8am-8pm, with noisy consturciton elevators running 12 hours a day and bright lights on 24/7. Avoid until the construction is over. Then, it will be a very nice place to stay.

Mar 17 2008	Great place to stay	We just got back from a 3 night stay at the Talbott hotel in Chicago. We had booked this through Hotwire so we didn't know we were staying here until after we had purchased through Hotwire. This was a great place to stay! I knew we had one of the smaller rooms - which was a Deluxe King room. But, once we walked into our room we saw that it was very spacious for a regular room. Very nice and updated decor, and everything was extremely clean. The first 2 nights we hardly saw any other guests in the hotel. Seemed like we had the place to ourselves which was a nice relief from the busy Chicago streets. I read others' complaints about the noise of construction next to the hotel which made me nervous since I'm a light sleeper. While we did see the construction, I never heard any of it - and we slept in most mornings until 9:30 or so. I read that the suites in the hotel had jacuzzi tubs, and I knew we didn't have one in ours as we had a regular room. However, the tub was very deep and great for soaking! (Might I add, this was the cleanest hotel tub I've seen in a long time!) We had a wonderful time staying here and the staff was wonderful and friendly. My husband did have one complaint - though the bed was comfortable, the down comforter on the bed wasn't long enough to cover his feet. His not extremely tall, about 6'0. So, that made sleeping a bit rougher on him, but overall we loved our stay!

Mar 12 2008 	Wonderful get away in Chicago	We have just returned from a weekend getaway at The Talbott Hotel. We were just thrilled with our decision to stay at The Talbott. The room was very comfortable and spotless. Everything seems to have been recently updated. The bed was especially comfortable with a down comforter. The location of the hotel itself allowed us to walk to a wide variety of restaurants and easy access to shopping at Water Tower and Michigan Avenue. The staff were all very friendly and informative. We were greeted with warm smiles and greetings every time. One concern is the dim lighting in the bathroom. Applying makeup and putting in contacts was easy however due to the lighted makeup mirror with a swing arm. The only other warning is the construction next door. We were on the 8th floor and the little noise we heard was not a problem. However, the construction was still on the ground level. In the next year or so, I would make sure to contact the hotel to determine which side of the hotel is noisy or not. Otherwise, we would recommend this as an intimate, well done hotel. I am sure we will be back in the future!

Mar 8 2008	Not Sure Why It's So Highly Rated	We booked a room at the Talbott in March, and I honestly don't understand what the attraction is. The staff was great--extremely friendly and accommodating. However, the rooms are small and nondescript, and the neighborhood is a construction zone, so it was incredibly noisy. I wouldn't recommend it to a friend.

Mar 6 2008 	Reliable Hotel Great Location	Our family stayed at the Talbott for a long weekend visiting family in Chicago. While the dark, psuedo English decor is not my taste, we found the hotel to be a great choice at a fair price. We loved the location and could walk to the Hancock tower, Michigan Avenue etc. Navy Pier was a $10 cab ride.The staff at the hotel are amazing. They helped get reservations that were impossible to get. They took packages. They delivered extra beds immediately.The hotel is connected to the restaurant BICE so the room service was great if priced for that type of high end restaurant. Breakfast was also delivered in 20 minutes which is unusual these days.The room was large. The bathroom had a tub and a stand alone shower. More importantly, it had Aveda products.We would stay here again.

Feb 1 2008 	The Best!	I stayed at the Talbott twice in the last few weeks. I was very pleased with every facet of my stays. The staff, from doormen to front desk, to concierge, to housekeeping, were wonderful. The rooms were nicely sized and clean, and well stocked. I will return to the Talbott anytime!

Jan 19 2008 	One of the Best Hotel Staffs you'll find in Chicago	After reading reviews on several websites I decided to book a room at the Talbott during one of the coldest times of the year. It was well worth it! From the second we arrived it was clear that the entire staff was hand picked and thoroughly trained to be warm and friendly. From the bellman to front desk to the maintenance man in the elevator....they all took time to say good morning and have a great day. That type of service is no accident. This place really was more than I expected for the price. Our suite was large and comfortable. The bathroom had a separate shower and the bath accessories were top notch. The hotel offers free morning coffee in the lobby but there is also a Starbucks right around the corner and everything worth seeing along the Mag Mile is within a short walk. I would stay there again. This is my first review submitted to Trip Advisor and I am doing this almost a year after my stay. I felt obligated to give credit where credit is due! This hotel felt more like a 5 star hotel than several of the 5 star hotels I have stayed at.

Jan 4 2008 	Great Hotel Fantastic Location	December 30 to 31 (not over New Year's eve). Our room rate was less than $140 booking through the hotel's reservations - this was a good deal for Chicago. Friendly staff, nicely decorated hotel and large size room (1409 corner King room). We arrived around 11:30 in the morning and SURPRISE, our room was READY!!!! Wow! That has Never happened before at any other hotel. This is a quaint boutique hotel located very close to Water Tower Place and the John Hancock building a stone's throw from the famous Magnificent Mile! About 5 blocks from the river (not a terrible walk if it's not too cold!).Rooms were recently redecorated (hotel style, but nice) and our bathroom had double sinks and a jacuzzi tub. Nice. Some negatives: Did not have have a flat panel TV and the TV was too small for the room size (since our room was so large, the TV was about 20 feet to the headboard!) The mini stereo/CD/Clock radio was cheap and made a funny burping sound when the music hit low notes (we were listening to jazz!) Another thing missing from this boutique hotel was a little complimentary wine and cheese around the cocktail hour.I would recommend this hotel to about $220 range, anything more I would be disappointed (see negative points).

Jan 1 2008 	The Talbott is lovely	This is a lovely small hotel in a great location. The staff is exceptionally gracious and helpful. The little restaurant-bar (Bice's) is exquisite, and its cocktails, wines, food, and service are excellent. The dark wood paneling throughout the common areas is warm and cozy. The theme of fox-hunting in the artwork is unfortunate, though, for those (like me) who find this "sport" barbaric.

Dec 14 2007	Great Experience	Stayed here for two nights, we were upgraded upon arrival to the executive suites. The room was huge if a little dark, howver the huge comfy bed and aveda products made up for it.Perfect location however found room service to be very pricey.

Dec 4 2007	disappointed	I have stayed in the Talbott a few times and had always liked it. This time was my first visit in 2 years and I was disappointed. The hallways are now looking tired and the carpets need to be replaced. I had asked for a corner room but instead was given a small and very dark room looking out onto a wall 10 feet away with multiple noisy vents immediately outside the window. The lights had to be kept on throughout the day even through the days were bright. The bathroom was tiny and would be difficult to manage with 2 people in the room. The AC unit rumbled on permanently with background white noise even when switched off. Having stayed there before I know there are better rooms but this one was the same price as the others I have been in and the risk is getting it again.Other small things contributed - the lobby brownies are no longer, there were no cup lids for the lobby coffee (so you couldn't walk out with the coffee) and I got a newspaper only on the last morning of a 5-night stay.The construction noise was not too bad but does start at 7.30am and goes on until around 8pm, including weekends.

Nov 13 2007 	Charming and plush and wonderful location	I booked last minute at the Talbott while in Chicago, and was very happy with my stay and services. The staff was friendly and helpful, especially the concierge with directions and recommendations. I stayed in a double queen-bed room, which was huge by traditional hotel room standards. The carpet was plush, the bed comfortable, and the other amenities quite thoughtful (such as umbrellas in the room just in case). Aveda bath products were also a nice touch. One caution: there is a large construction site next to the hotel, so rooms facing that side will be noisy after 8:00 a.m. most mornings. The front desk staff was accommodating though and offered to move me if the noise was too much.I would highly recommend this hotel, and definitely would stay there again.
Nov 13 2007 	Best in the city	This hotel is a classic - richly appointed and has the friendliest most helpfui staff I've ever encountered. Can't wait to get back.

Nov 5 2007 	Great Hotel	Chicago is one of our favorite cities to visit. Some friends suggested trying The Talbott. I'm delighted we took them up. The Talbott is a great "small" hotel a block and a half off of Michigan Avenue near the Four Seasons, Drake and Westin.The concierge staff was most helpfull. Gene and Stephanie took great care of us.The rooms were spacious and very fresh. The elevators could be a bit slow at times. Aside from the construction next door, our stay was perfect.Bice now runs the hotel restaurant. We enjoyed having breakfast there.We will stay there again.

Oct 30 2007	Supurb Boutique Hotel AWESOME location authentic connected service	OK, I love visiting the most friendly, clean, delightful city in the world,Chicago. Oct 24 2007	Excellent boutique hotel	Although The Talbott may seem expensive it gives full value and is in a very good location. Oct 23 2007	Friendly staff beautiful hotel in heart of Downtown Chicago	The reservationists are rude on the phone but when I arrived at the hotel the staff was very accommodating and friendly. Oct 13 2007 	A fine choice	The Talbott is a boutique hotel in the Gold Coast part of Chicago. It is just a few blocks from Hancock Tower, Watertower Place, and Michigan Avenue. It is a little North of some points of interest, such as the Navy Pier or the Art Institute, requiring 20 - 30 min of walking to get to these sites or ~$12 dollar cab ride.The hotel itelf is very attractive and personal. The decor is traditional, with tasteful prints and furniture. (For some reason, the Talbott is big on fox huning themes). The rooms are large and comfortable. I stayed in a one room suite, which was very spacious, well-decorated, and very clean. The size and layout was ideal in terms of privacy, in that a family can place 1 - 2 people in the living room, which is separated from the bedroom by the sizable bathroom suite. Other features of the hotel include free WiFi (which was a little buggy), and a restaurant.Overall, this a is fine, personal hotel that makes it a good alternative to the large hotels in the area. One possible issue is that a major building is being constructed immediately behind the Talbott. Work begins at 7:30 am, so noise could be a problem for those wanting to sleep-in or grab a mid-day nap. However, this is probably a short-term issue, and I recommend the Talbott highly.

Oct 1 2007 	The Talbott is great!!!	My girlfriends and I stayed 4 nights at the Talbott returning home on Saturday 9/29. We all had a wonderful time and thoroughly enjoyed the hotel. The staff from top to bottom were excellent, accommodating. The room was roomy...with our only complaint being not being able to cool the room fast enough after a day on the town. The construction next door was obstructing the sidewalk, but being on a oneway street limited that difficulty. The doorman, Andrew was an excellent source at this hotel. He arranged all our transportation at night to restaurants. We enjoyed everything about the hotel and the city. The hotel was expensive but met expectations.

Oct 1 2007 	Nice rooms service not always	The rooms in the Talbott are good, large and recently refurbished. The WiFi internet is good and free of charge. The staff is not always as friendly as they should be, but overall this stay was nice. The location is great, just of Michigan Ave.

Sep 17 2007 	One of the worst hotels I've stayed at	I can easily say this is one of the worst hotels I've stayed at the. The receptionist up front was a snooty, sarcastic teenager or post teenager. You can get better service from a waiter or waitress at a diner. The room was dirty, stains on the carpet, the showerhead was moldy and rusted, the doors of the bathroom and main door all had dents and scratches. The towels had a horrible aroma. The hotel is very narrow, so we were near a construction zone so, I would plan on waking up at 6:am if you choose the Talbott. The next day, I asked for another room and the concierge who was a decent guy moved us to a larger more comfortable room. That room though was right by the elevator and it was torture hearing the sounds of the elevator which just would never stop. I asked for late checkout at 1pm and the receptionist refused stating that we would be charged for a half day, if were not out by noon. I had to speak to the manager who gave us till 1pm. Please stay away from this hotel, I think a Holiday Inn would be better.Andrew F. Gulli

Sep 15 2007 	Nice Boutique Hotel in the Gold Coast	The Talbott is a real nice boutique hotel right in the heart of the Gold Coast, one of the nicest neighborhoods in Chicago, and about 1.5 blocks from the Magnificent Mile. The lobby finishes and the staff were very friendly, and appeared to be accomidating. We didn't really need anything, but if we did, we could have asked anybody, and they would have helped us. The room well apointed, and the bed was very comfortable. The bathroom was nice and has a timed heater function, that can be used in the bitter Chicago winter mornings. The location of the hotel is increadible. You are two blocks from the Red Line "L" train that runs all hours of the day. You are 2 blocks from The Bloomingdales building, John Hancock Building, Water Tower, and all the shops on Michigan Avenue. You are by great restaurants, shopping, and transportation.This hotel is a good deal for the location and accomidations. I would definetly recommend this hotel; however, read the WARNING BELOW:******WARNING********There are 3 major constructions occuring to the west, and north of the building. Construction is at the early stages of this property, but in the coming year(s), major construction will occur, and it will be right next door to the hotel. We were on the 13th floor (lucky), but we heard very faint construction, Tuesday moring. My big suggestion, would be to get a high floor room, and by around next year at this time, be warned of major construction at this location.

Sep 3 2007 	2nd time just as great as 1st	My 2nd stay at the Talbott within a year and it was just as great as the first time. Was in a standard 2 full bed bedroom for 3 people. Room was a big size. bathroom was nice. desk and easy chair as well. 4th floor yet was bright and airy. Front desk was great, concierge very helpful and resourceful. Great location; a block from John Hancock building as well as miracle mile with all the shopping. Price can not be beat. down the street 4 seasons charges 500+ for a room while we paid 200 for the night. New restaurant on premises (Bice ) which looked great. Have stayed in Talbott 1 br king suite and that was wonderful but couch in separate living room is not a pull out. I will certainly make this my chicago hotel. around the corner have breakfast at El Tempo (best breakfasts) or Eisnstein bagel a block away. Hotel is so central. Enjoy, we did

Aug 27 2007 	Perfect Hotel!!	We booked a double room suite, the size was like an apartment, the bathroom was huge and the hotel has an excellent location, we have all the restaurants and shopping two blocks away.
Aug 26 2007 	The Talbott was a Treat!	Great staff, quiet, and well appointed room. Walking distance from great shopping!

Aug 21 2007 	Treasure in Chicago	If you are looking for a delightful, small hotel in the heart of Chicago, The Talbott is for you. It is a perfect location and a true hideaway from the chaotic city. We had a standard room and it was very large. The bathrooms are small, but that comes with an older hotel. The beds were awesome as was the maid service. The staff was excellent...always helpful and attentive...we all loved the bellmen! The only complaint would be that the bar closes very early....sometimes before 11PM.

Aug 9 2007 	The Best Place to turn 30!!!!	We stayed at the Talbott from the 4th-7th of August and it was wonderful. We were steps from several streets that had tons to do. We also bought 3 day bus passes and just jumped on and off around town seeing and doing everything we could pack in 4 full days. Gene at the concierge desk checked us in for our flight before we got to the airport on our way out, he booked us reservations to restaurants, gave us an umbrella when it started to rain, held our bags when we checked out as we had a late flight so we wondered around town some more, and he gave us directions to this place and that place. Our room was always clean and they put my flowers in the room that arrived for my birthday from a friend. We love to travel and go to new places trying not to repeat trips as we all know so much to do and see out there, but I would go back to the Talbott and especially Chicago. Everyone was super nice and super informative. Although do not eat at the place in the hotel, way overpriced and not that wonderful, nor was our waiter or the wrestling on the TV. If you need great places to eat, Quartinos on State ask for Zach he was awesome, great for lunch as it gets really crowded at dinner, Devon we went to late and it is super nice and the food is terrific, Kitchs'n on Chicago, way down Chicago, they have soy lattes, i was sooooooooo happy, it is in the same place as Japonaise which is also wonderful and beautiful, do not go on a weekend to japonaise way too crowded. we went on a monday night and it still got really crowded but we were already there when the crowd rolled in at 7pm plus they have a beautiful bar downstairs, order all appetizers so you can try everything. Giordanos on Michigan and Superior (get there at 1045am walk to the bar and order your pizza as it takes 45 min to cook so when you sit down at 11 you can eat a salad or something then your pizza comes and you will not be waiting in line for 2 hours like everyone else, i recommened the stuffed spinach if you just like your pizza easy cheese instead of overly cheesy), if you want a specialty coffee shop the only one i found in the city is Cafe Deluca on Damen in Wiker Park everything else is a starbucks. The people were nice and it is very Austin, Texas the entire area. Hope this was helpful. Check out the free trolleys, stained glass museum (navy Pier), botanical garden and zoo (lincoln Park), millienium park, beach, etc. I LOVE CHICAGO!!! If you go in August like we did take extra shorts, i wore jeans thinking it would be lots cooler than Texas, wrong. :-)

Jul 5 2007 	Great night at the Talbott	My girlfriend and I live in Chicago but decided to play tourists for a night and stay at a hotel downtown. The Talbott was wonderful. It's in a great location -- about 2 blocks from the John Hancock and just steps from Rush Street. The room was clean. The bed was comfy. The Aveda shower products were a nice touch, as was the free wireless Internet. The hotel staff was extremely friendly. The doorman downstairs informed us that we could get a couple bucks off parking at a nearby garage by getting a validation ticket at the front desk. We were impressed that he helped us out even though we had decided to park the car ourselves rather than using the hotel's valet service.After taking a shower, I discovered that the hair dryer in our bathroom wasn't working. I called downstairs and they immediately sent up an engineer to check out the problem. Upon discovering that the dryer was, indeed, broken, he immediately fetched another one for me. The entire process -- from the time I phoned the front desk -- took about 15 minutes. It was quick, easy, and again, very friendly.I would absolutely recommend the hotel to anyone looking to stay in the River North/Gold Coast area.

Jun 29 2007 	Pleasantly surprised	My husband attended a conference in Chicago for the weekend of June 22nd and I decided to tag along for the shopping! We flew into O'Hare and took a cab to the hotel, cost about $30. Everybody from the doorman to reception desk to concierge were extremely friendly and helpful. We had a room on the 9th floor which overlooked the construction, but we were hardly in the room so it didn't bother us. We were also never awakened due to construction noise and my husband is a very light sleeper. The room was clean and spacious enough for us. The bed is very comfy. We ate in the restaurant downstairs several times for breakfast and lunch and all meals were great. The location of this hotel is perfect. You are about 1&1/2 blocks from Michigan Ave and the Hancock tower. Can't beat that! There is also an adorable pet store called Tails In The City across from the hotel! I brought our dog back a couple of toys! They are very nice as well. All in all, no complaints. The hotel is clean and beyond what we were expecting. The staff is always friendly and the location is superb. It's a safe neighborhood-I walked around by myself and felt fine. We would definitely return.

Jun 17 2007 	Perfect place to stay	My boyfriend and I just returned from our second stay at The Talbott. It was wonderful to see the same friendly staff and they welcomed us with kind words, good service, and efficient checkin.Our room was an executive king suite (701)- roomy, great beds and bedding and an incredibly large bathroom. The bathroom had 2 sinks and large tub and separate shower. The only thing not so great were the livingroom chairs (very uncomfortable) and outdated televisions. However, we were told that new flat screens have been ordered. The maid service was efficient and rooms were very clean.I tried the complimentary pass to the fitness club which was only a 5 minute walk from hotel. I recommend it. We did not eat at the hotel nor did we try room service but I am sure it would be great as the restaurant was always busy and the food did look yummy.The concierge staff was extremely helpful and made reservations and suggestions for us, etc.We love this hotel for its location and understated elegance among all the other reasons I have mentioned.

Jun 7 2007 	Classy 	Mid-May my husband and I stayed at the Talbott Hotel in Chicago for 3 nights. It was awesome! The hotel's website does not reflect how beautiful and stylish it is. I have attached our pictures so you can understand. The rooms have been updated and are gorgeous, elegant, and sparkling clean. I told the front desk that they have to update their website! It does not reflect the hotel at all. We had booked a regular king room and when we arrived we found out we had been upgraded to a suite! The suite was huge! Practically the size of our apartment in DC!Again the rooms are newly refurbished. We had a beautiful bedroom with European, old world style furnishings, a living room, and the most amazing bathroom with 2 sinks, a shower, and soaking hot tub. Even though there was construction going on we never heard a thing! They have really good, thick windows.The hotel is in a really fun part of Chicago called the "Gold Coast". There are tons of cool shops and restaurants all within the blocks of the hotel. It is about a 10 minute walk to the Magnificent Mile and river. We never used it but they give you complimentary passes to a nearby gym. We had the buffet breakfast in the charming bistro. The lobby is really warm and inviting and the staff fabulous and professional.I totally recommend The Talbott Hotel!

Jun 3 2007 	sweet home in chicago	We bookended a recent trip to Illinois, Wisconsin and Michigan with two visits to Chicago, where we stayed both times at the small but elegant Talbott Hotel. Apr 30 2007 	Great Choice!	My husband and I stayed from April 27 to April 29th. It was my first trip to the city. This was a terrific location - it was close to great shopping and good restaurants. Mar 16 2007	Spring Break Base	Stayed 5 nights at this great hotel. Updated rooms. Clean. Used Tim to book theater and dinning reservations. Provided excellent service. Mar 3 2007 	Great Place to Stay	My wife and I stayed two nights at the Talbott at the end of February. This little hotel was the perfect place for us. Mar 2 2007	Great surprise at the Talbott	After hearing my second daughter from college was meeting us in Chicago, we needed a roll away in our suite we had booked at another hotel . Feb 11 2007 	Excellent hotel	I only had one night in Chicago - and a cold one it was too! However, the Talbott hotel kept me warm and comfortable. Jan 20 2007	Europe in Chicago	As we pulled away in a taxi heading to the airport for our trip home my wife turned to me and said "We picked the right place." Nov 11 2006 	An Outstanding Hotel in a Big City	I stayed at the Talbott for 18 days while working at a tradeshow at McCormick Place. I was a little worried - being assigned to a smaller hotel - you just never know - you really have to trust the reviews. Boy was I thrilled. The hotel is on a tree lined street, within a half block of the Four Seasons (that tells you the neighborhood is in fact nice). The best part of Magnificient Mile is two short blocks away - you can see Michigan Avenue from the hotel. The doorman greets you as you arrive. There was one present almost 24 hours a day.When you walk in, there is a small lobby, with a living room style seating area on each side with a fireplace. You immediately get a cozy feeling. I had arrived very early the day of the Chicago Marathon, it was cold, and I was wet from the rain - they got me a room within an hour (was sold out the night before so they really rushed).I had an executive king - a very large room with a huge bathroom with a seperate tub and shower. Aveeda soaps, etc. All the furnishings were new - in good shape, soft bedding and nice carpet. I asked if they had a small refrigerator since I would be there so long, and they brought me one along with a microwave. Day in and day out the service was excellent. From the doorman to the concierge, to the maid, everyone was very pleasant and helpful. One of the front desk attendants knew I liked bananas, and when she was on duty, made sure the fruit bowl with the apples and oranges had bananas also. There was a beautiful but small bar - with gorgeous wood. I was mostly too tired to ever go in. There was fresh coffee - complimentary - each morning, along with the fruit.If I had to nit pick - there are some areas in the hallway to the rooms that could use some touch up paint - after being hit repeatedly by the luggage cart. The food could have been better too, I never ate it, but both my work mates declared it could be better - but I always went out - around the corner to some great Italian food at Pizano's or the other many restaurants on Rush. I rarely eat at hotels - the local food is too good to pass up and since this hotel is so close to everything you can walk out, and turn towards any direction and find good restaurants and shops.This hotel is for people who like small intimate settings, cozy, one on one service with people who remember your name and who don't need loud bars and restaurants, etc. I travel for a living and prefer this style of hotel - I want a quiet place, upscale furnishings and great service. The Talbott delivers. We had almost 50 staff in from all over the country, and the hotel booking service had us in about 10 different hotels. Based on what everyone said about their hotel, and the many I saw when visiting others over the three weeks, I know the Talbott was superior! If I don't get to stay there again the next time, I will be disappointed!I fell in love with Chicago and the Talbott Hotel!

Aug 15 2006 	Talbott was great for anniversary weekend	My wife and I loved the Talbott for our anniversary. It is a smaller hotel, but it was perfect for us. Aug 9 2006	Avoid The Talbot	Avoid The Talbot, especially for group functions. My in-laws spent a great deal of time trying to find just the right hotel to use for our wedding party and several out of town guests. They were lured in by promises from The Talbot, that since they were a small boutique hotel that they could provide "special, personal treatment". Nothing could have been further from the truth. They failed to honor two requests to keep the bar open after our reception, they persistently confused reservation requests, they front desk failed to contact the valet despite multiple requests and nearly caused of my guests, his wife, and his two year old daughter to miss their departing flight. Now the worse part. Mistakes are made, even hotel managers are human, but where a hotel, which is supposed to be in the hospitality service, can distinguish itself is in how they handle and correct the error. Case in point: I had requested on several occasions when I made the reservations for my family that they all be placed under my credit card, all expenses, they assurred me that this would be no problem. Of course, when my brother, his wife, and asthmatic five year old arrived to searing hot and humid Chicago after six hours of travel they wouldn't let them check in until they physically saw my card... again despite them having my card on record, and despite my explaining this to them over the phone. My brother recalls the "indignation" of the desk clerk when he mentioned that the charges were to be put on my card. Then Another guest, in this case my older brother, came by and put the charges onto his card so that the five year old could escape the heat and the prolonged waiting in the lobby. When I finally was able to get across town, leaving a Cubs game early, I again spoke to them about putting all the charges on my account. Again they agreed, but never did anything about it. In the end when my older brother checked out on Sunday he was told everything was alright, but when he went to his ATM his account was frozen from "unathorized overuse". The hotel kept billing his debit card automatically for multiple charges ubtil his account was essentially drained. When he got home he had to take an entire day off to discuss with his bank how to rectify these events. I spent Sunday afternoon for an hour and three hours on Monday, the first two days of my honeymoon on the phone, calling The Talbot, the credit card fraud division, my brother, etc trying to solve this situation. The most aggregious insults continued to come form the covering manager, who at one point suggested that "I was mistaken about coming back down to talk with the desk clerk about these matters".... this was a witnessed event, and her insinuation was that I was lying, and that there was no way her clerk could have made a mistake. In the end, there is no one running this place... managers from one department refer you to the manager of another departments voice mail. When I was finally able to get the name of the general manager (after two days)m neither he nor his assistant would ever call back. The communication between the staff and mangement is non-existant.Fortuneatly the staff at the Signature Room (where we had the reception) was beyond excellent so the day was not lost, but the The Talbot went out of its way to insult and poorly serve my family and many of our wedding guests.Try The Ambassador East (same neighborhood) cheaper, much more professional staff.

Jul 30 2006	Bait and Switch	We reserved a room with a sleeper couch a few weeks before our stay. Jul 11 2006	Thought the Talbott was great	I'm a fairly frequent recreation traveler and like nice, unique hotes. My criteria for Chicago was a smaller, independent, upscale hotel in a great location. The morning that I did have breakfast, I was in a rush and they made sure that i was waited on promply and my order came out in a timely manner. Everything else, I thought, was well above average for a hotel in that price range. When I think back to making our reservation, even the hotel reservaton agent was excellent. Good job Talbott!

Jan 4 2006	Nice Choice for Chicago	We really liked this hotel. It was very clean and tidy, the room was quite spacious, and the staff was friendly. The location was extremely convenient to shopping and good dining. The free cookies and coffee in the afternoon were excellent. The bed was great, the bathroom was modern and nice. My only complaint was that the concierge seemed a bit overwhelmed all the time, but when you finally could talk to them they were helpful. It's pricey, but a bargain compared to its neighbors and typical big-city prices.

Oct 17 2005	Don't choose the Talbot	Great front desk staff, the rest of the experience was dreadful. The room service staff have to be among the most poorly trained I have ever encountered. We had to ask FOUR times for the staff not to slam the supply closet, adjacent to our room (almost in the room itself). They do these random room checks for the minibar, as if the entire budget hinged on the sale of a can of $9 peanuts. The roomservice is also equipped with walkie-talkies as loud as megaphones. If you like sleeping in on your vacation, don't stay here. Also, the hotel was under massive construction, a detail that was conveniently excluded from the website. SO we had to take the elevator with construction workers just about every time we used it. No discount because of the work and noise. I'd rather sleep in a box in the alley.

Oct 8 2005	Friendly Little Boutique Hotel	I just returned from Chicago with a girlfriend. The Talbott was a very nice place to stay. It is a smaller hotel, but it has the best service. It is the kind of place where everyone knows your name and wants you to have the best experience possible. The conceirge was so helpful getting us into the best restraunts on a last minutes notice, also finding us Oprah tickets! They also printed up my boarding pass, delivered it to my room and did not charge me for their service. They do not nickel and dime you for everything at this hotel. The rooms were very spacious and clean, nice Aveada products in the bathroom and it stayed at a very comfortable temperature. We had 2 queen beds and had plenty of room to move around. It is a short 1.5 blocks from all the shopping and food on Michigan Ave. The American Girl Store was very close by and a must for people with little girls in their lives. The only downsides I can think of is the view from our window was not very great but it was no big deal for us because we only looked outside once. Also there are only 2 elevators so if it was very busy you may have to wait, but we did not have a problem with that. Overall, we were very pleased with our choice to stay there. It was a very intimate hotel and we felt very at home. We cannot wait to go back there for more shopping and fun.

Oct 6 2005	Quality Down Rates UP Typical Syndrome	Any traveler who is loyal to a favorite hotel has experienced this sad truth: eventually the lodging deteriorates. But you do not expect the price to double and triple at the same time!I have been staying at the Talbott for several decades.Yes, changes have been made, like the updated heating and cooling systems and the front entrance, most recently.But other things have gone downhill. For the last several stays I have experienced very dirty carpets and slow service.Rates have skyrocketed and now they are asking for 3 night minimum stays on many occasions. Aug 30 2005	A wonderful experiance!	We booked at another hotel a block away and spent a unhappy night. Aug 29 2005 	Cozy and wonderful!	I loved the Talbott! Everything was wonderful. The staff was very friendly and went out of their way to make my stay enjoyable.
